intro: Hieracium constans, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with upright stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, producing small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium constans is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
